com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.data_analytics

Interface IAnalyticsContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IUnderlyingService

    public interface IAnalyticsContext
extends IUnderlyingService
    A context library that is always passed to the IAnalyticsTechnology module and can also be passed to the analytics library processing
    Author:
    acp

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkForListeners(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      This checks whether another analytic job has requested a stream of objects - if so then sendObjectToStreamingPipeline can be used to forward them
      void emergencyDisableBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Requests that the analytic thread be suspended - in addition to changing the analytic thread state, this will result in a call to IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onSuspend
      void emergencyQuarantineBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, String quarantine_duration)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Requests that the analytic thread be suspended for the specified duration - in addition to changing the analytic thread state, this will result in a call to IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onSuspend
      fj.data.Validation<BasicMessageBean,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> emitObject(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object, Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
      (Analytic Module only) For output modules for the particular technology to output objects reasonably efficient, if an output service is not available Also supports: a) writing objects to sub-buckets (use the sub-bucket full_name - the system will fill the rest in) b) external buckets (again - only the full name is required, the system will authorize and fill in)
      CompletableFuture<?> flushBatchOutput(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      (Analytic Module only) Flushes any pending batch output, eg before a process exits
      List<String> getAnalyticsContextLibraries(Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
      (AnalyticsTechnology only) A list of JARs that can be copied to an external process (eg Hadoop job) to provide the result client access to this context (and other services) Can't call getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
      String getAnalyticsContextSignature(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
      (AnalyticsTechnology only) This string should be passed into ContextUtils.getAnalyticsContext to retrieve this class from within external clients Can't call getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
      CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getAnalyticsLibraries(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs)
      (AnalyticsTechnology only) For each library defined by the thread.module_names_or_ids/thread.analytic_name_or_id, returns a FileSystem path
      Optional<DataBucketBean> getBucket()
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the specified bucket
      <S> ICrudService<S> getBucketObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, Optional<String> collection, Optional<AssetStateDirectoryBean.StateDirectoryType> type)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns an object repository that the harvester/module can use to store arbitrary internal state.
      CompletableFuture<DataBucketStatusBean> getBucketStatus(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket (whhch contains AnalyticThreadStatusBean)
      <S> ICrudService<S> getGlobalAnalyticTechnologyObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, Optional<String> collection)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Get the global (ie analytic technology-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store
      List<String> getInputPaths(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) For jobs that read from file (either temporary or persistent), this provides a set of file paths from which to read
      List<String> getInputTopics(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) For jobs that read from real-time queues, this provides a set of topics from which to read (Will also subscribe to the bucket so that the related bucket will start streaming if it is not already)
      Optional<AnalyticThreadJobBean> getJob()
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the specified job
      Map<String,SharedLibraryBean> getLibraryConfigs()
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the library beans optionally specified in the analytic job's module_name_or_id/library_name_or_ids The libraries bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state, and to get entry points into modular functionality To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get()) This can also be used to obtain BucketUtils.getStreamingEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getBatchEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getEntryPoint
      <S> Optional<ICrudService<S>> getLibraryObjectStore(Class<S> clazz, String name_or_id, Optional<String> collection)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Get the global (ie module library-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store, if a module has been specified
      IBucketLogger getLogger(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns a logger configured for the given DataBucketBean.
      Optional<scala.Tuple2<String,Optional<String>>> getOutputPath(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Gets the path to which this (possibly) intermediate job should write data For non-temporary jobs that write to file, or permanent jobs with no temporal settings - a single string is returned, which is the path to which to write For bucket output with temporal settings, 2 strings are returned - the first is the base directory, the second is a DateFormat string that is the time-based sub-directory to which files should be written (If the bucket has no file output then no strings are returned) Note that for any specific technology it is possible to request an outputter of the right format via getServiceOutput instead - if it exists then it will likely contain an efficient pre-built module Or just write your own outputter calling emitOutput
      Optional<String> getOutputTopic(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Gets the topic to which this (possibly) intermediate job should stream real-time data This is for passing the topic into an external library - alternatively sendObjectToStreamingPipeline can be called
      IServiceContext getServiceContext()
      (Analytic Module only) Returns context to return a service - for external clients, the corresponding library JAR must have been copied into the class file (path given by getAnalyticsContextLibraries) (NOTE: analytic technology modules do not need this, they can access the service context directly via the @Inject annotation)
      <T extends IAnalyticsAccessContext<?>>
      Optional<T>      		 getServiceInput(Class<T> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
      For data services, you can either request an underlying technology (eg InputFormat for Hadoop/RichSpout for Storm/etc), or an ICrudService (of JsonNode) as a backup Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
      <T extends IAnalyticsAccessContext<?>>
      Optional<T>      		 getServiceOutput(Class<T> clazz, Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, String data_service)
      Requests a technology-specific output for the given data service (eg OutputFormat for Hadoop/Bolt for Storm/etc), or an IDataWriteService (of JsonNode) as a backup Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
      SharedLibraryBean getTechnologyConfig()
      (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed This library bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get())
      void initializeNewContext(String signature)
      (Should never be called by clients) this is used by the infrastructure to set up external contexts
      fj.data.Validation<BasicMessageBean,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> sendObjectToStreamingPipeline(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket, AnalyticThreadJobBean job, fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object, Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
      (Analytic Module only) If another component is requesting streaming access to the output (use checkForListeners to find out) then this utility function will output the objects Note emitObject automatically checks for this, so this only need be called if emitObject is not being used.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.shared_services.IUnderlyingService

        getUnderlyingArtefacts, getUnderlyingPlatformDriver

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceContext

        IServiceContext getServiceContext()
        (Analytic Module only) Returns context to return a service - for external clients, the corresponding library JAR must have been copied into the class file (path given by getAnalyticsContextLibraries) (NOTE: analytic technology modules do not need this, they can access the service context directly via the @Inject annotation)
        Returns:
        the service context

      • sendObjectToStreamingPipeline

        fj.data.Validation<BasicMessageBean,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> sendObjectToStreamingPipeline(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                                                                                           AnalyticThreadJobBean job,
                                                                                                           fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object,
                                                                                                           Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
        (Analytic Module only) If another component is requesting streaming access to the output (use checkForListeners to find out) then this utility function will output the objects Note emitObject automatically checks for this, so this only need be called if emitObject is not being used.
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        stage - - if set to Optionals.empty() or "$end" then occurs post enrichment. If set to "" or "$start" then occurs pre-enrichment. Otherwise should be the name of a module - will listen immediately after that.
        object - the object to emit represented by either Jackson JsonNode or a generic map-of-objects

      • emitObject

        fj.data.Validation<BasicMessageBean,com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> emitObject(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                                                                        AnalyticThreadJobBean job,
                                                                                        fj.data.Either<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode,Map<String,Object>> object,
                                                                                        Optional<AnnotationBean> annotations)
        (Analytic Module only) For output modules for the particular technology to output objects reasonably efficient, if an output service is not available Also supports: a) writing objects to sub-buckets (use the sub-bucket full_name - the system will fill the rest in) b) external buckets (again - only the full name is required, the system will authorize and fill in)
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - - the job for which data is being output
        object - the object to emit represented by either Jackson JsonNode or a generic map-of-objects
        annotation - - the generic annotation parameters can either be copied directly into the object, or appended via this bean (merging if the object also has annotatiosn)

      • flushBatchOutput

        CompletableFuture<?> flushBatchOutput(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                      AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
        (Analytic Module only) Flushes any pending batch output, eg before a process exits
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - the job for which data is being output
        Returns:
        a undefined future that completes when the batch output completes

      • getOutputPath

        Optional<scala.Tuple2<String,Optional<String>>> getOutputPath(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                                              AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Gets the path to which this (possibly) intermediate job should write data For non-temporary jobs that write to file, or permanent jobs with no temporal settings - a single string is returned, which is the path to which to write For bucket output with temporal settings, 2 strings are returned - the first is the base directory, the second is a DateFormat string that is the time-based sub-directory to which files should be written (If the bucket has no file output then no strings are returned) Note that for any specific technology it is possible to request an outputter of the right format via getServiceOutput instead - if it exists then it will likely contain an efficient pre-built module Or just write your own outputter calling emitOutput
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - - the job being run
        Returns:
        - optionally (if the job requires file-based output) the base path and the temporal suffix that can be passed to eg SimpleDateFormat

      • getOutputTopic

        Optional<String> getOutputTopic(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Gets the topic to which this (possibly) intermediate job should stream real-time data This is for passing the topic into an external library - alternatively sendObjectToStreamingPipeline can be called
        Parameters:
        bucket -
        job -
        Returns:

      • getInputPaths

        List<String> getInputPaths(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                           AnalyticThreadJobBean job,
                           AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) For jobs that read from file (either temporary or persistent), this provides a set of file paths from which to read
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - - the job being run
        job_input - - the specific input to check against for the job being run (each job can have multiple inputs)
        Returns:
        - A collection of paths (directories) to check

      • getInputTopics

        List<String> getInputTopics(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                            AnalyticThreadJobBean job,
                            AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) For jobs that read from real-time queues, this provides a set of topics from which to read (Will also subscribe to the bucket so that the related bucket will start streaming if it is not already)
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - - the job being run
        job_input - - the specific input to check against for the job being run (each job can have multiple inputs)
        Returns:
        - A collection of topics (for a real-time queue) to which to subscribe (eg using ICoreDistributed.consumeAs, or a Storm spout if using Storm, or etc)

      • getServiceInput

        <T extends IAnalyticsAccessContext<?>> Optional<T> getServiceInput(Class<T> clazz,
                                                                   Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                                                   AnalyticThreadJobBean job,
                                                                   AnalyticThreadJobBean.AnalyticThreadJobInputBean job_input)
        For data services, you can either request an underlying technology (eg InputFormat for Hadoop/RichSpout for Storm/etc), or an ICrudService (of JsonNode) as a backup Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
        Parameters:
        clazz - - the requested class, note all CRUD services will always return an ICrudService, but more useful technology-specific higher-level constructs may also be possible
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - - the job being run
        job_input - - the specific input to check against for the job being run (each job can have multiple inputs)
        Returns:
        an instances of the requested class if available

      • getServiceOutput

        <T extends IAnalyticsAccessContext<?>> Optional<T> getServiceOutput(Class<T> clazz,
                                                                    Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                                                    AnalyticThreadJobBean job,
                                                                    String data_service)
        Requests a technology-specific output for the given data service (eg OutputFormat for Hadoop/Bolt for Storm/etc), or an IDataWriteService (of JsonNode) as a backup Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
        Parameters:
        clazz - - the requested class, note all CRUD services will always return an ICrudService, but more useful technology-specific higher-level constructs may also be possible
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - - the job being run
        data_service - - the data service to which to write (ie to which the request is being sent)
        Returns:
        an instance of the requested class if available, else empty

      • checkForListeners

        boolean checkForListeners(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                          AnalyticThreadJobBean job)
        This checks whether another analytic job has requested a stream of objects - if so then sendObjectToStreamingPipeline can be used to forward them
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        job - - the job being run
        Returns:
        whether another bucket is listening for this bucket

      • getAnalyticsContextLibraries

        List<String> getAnalyticsContextLibraries(Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
        (AnalyticsTechnology only) A list of JARs that can be copied to an external process (eg Hadoop job) to provide the result client access to this context (and other services) Can't call getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
        Parameters:
        services - an optional set of service classes (with optionally service name - not needed unless a non-default service is needed) that are needed (only the libraries needed for the context is provided otherwise)
        Returns:
        the path (in a format that makes sense to IStorageService)

      • getAnalyticsContextSignature

        String getAnalyticsContextSignature(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                    Optional<Set<scala.Tuple2<Class<? extends IUnderlyingService>,Optional<String>>>> services)
        (AnalyticsTechnology only) This string should be passed into ContextUtils.getAnalyticsContext to retrieve this class from within external clients Can't call getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries with different 'services' parameter Can't call getUnderlyingArtefacts without having called getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries Can't call getServiceInput/Output after getAnalyticsContextSignature/getAnalyticsContextLibraries
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        services - an optional set of service classes (with optionally service name - not needed unless a non-default service is needed) that are needed (only the libraries needed for the context is provided otherwise)
        Returns:
        an opaque string that can be passed into ContextUtils.getAnalyticsContext

      • getAnalyticsLibraries

        CompletableFuture<Map<String,String>> getAnalyticsLibraries(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                                            Collection<AnalyticThreadJobBean> jobs)
        (AnalyticsTechnology only) For each library defined by the thread.module_names_or_ids/thread.analytic_name_or_id, returns a FileSystem path
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        A Future containing a map of filesystem paths with key both the name and id of the library

      • getGlobalAnalyticTechnologyObjectStore

        <S> ICrudService<S> getGlobalAnalyticTechnologyObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                                           Optional<String> collection)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Get the global (ie analytic technology-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository visible to all users of this analytic technology

      • getLibraryObjectStore

        <S> Optional<ICrudService<S>> getLibraryObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                                    String name_or_id,
                                                    Optional<String> collection)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Get the global (ie module library-specific _not_ bucket-specific) object data store, if a module has been specified
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository visible to all users of this module

      • getBucketObjectStore

        <S> ICrudService<S> getBucketObjectStore(Class<S> clazz,
                                         Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                                         Optional<String> collection,
                                         Optional<AssetStateDirectoryBean.StateDirectoryType> type)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns an object repository that the harvester/module can use to store arbitrary internal state.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the bean or object type desired (needed so the repo can reason about the type when deciding on optimizations etc)
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        collection - - arbitrary string, enables the user to split the per bucket state into multiple independent collections. If left empty then returns a directory of existing collections (clazz has to be AssetStateDirectoryBean.class)
        type - - if left blank then points to the analytics type, else can retrieve other types of object store (shared_library - bucket is then ignored, enrichment, or harvest)
        Returns:
        a generic object repository

      • getBucket

        Optional<DataBucketBean> getBucket()
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the specified bucket
        Returns:
        The bucket that this job is running for, or Optional.empty() if that is ambiguous

      • getJob

        Optional<AnalyticThreadJobBean> getJob()
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the specified job
        Returns:
        The job that is currently running, or Optional.empty() if that is ambiguous

      • getTechnologyConfig

        SharedLibraryBean getTechnologyConfig()
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed This library bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get())
        Returns:
        the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed

      • getLibraryConfigs

        Map<String,SharedLibraryBean> getLibraryConfigs()
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the library beans optionally specified in the analytic job's module_name_or_id/library_name_or_ids The libraries bean can be used together with the CoreManagementDb (getPerLibraryState) to store/retrieve state, and to get entry points into modular functionality To convert the library_config field to a bean, just use Optional.ofNullable(_context.getLibraryConfig().library_config()).map(j -> BeanTemplateUtils.from(j).get()) This can also be used to obtain BucketUtils.getStreamingEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getBatchEntryPoint or BucketUtils.getEntryPoint
        Returns:
        the library bean that provided the user callback currently being executed

      • getBucketStatus

        CompletableFuture<DataBucketStatusBean> getBucketStatus(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns the status bean for the specified bucket (whhch contains AnalyticThreadStatusBean)
        Parameters:
        bucket - An optional bucket - if there is no ambiguity in the bucket then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another bucket than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        Returns:
        A Future containing a bean containing the harvests state and status

      • getLogger

        IBucketLogger getLogger(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Returns a logger configured for the given DataBucketBean.
        Parameters:
        bucket -
        Returns:

      • emergencyDisableBucket

        void emergencyDisableBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Requests that the analytic thread be suspended - in addition to changing the analytic thread state, this will result in a call to IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onSuspend
        Parameters:
        bucket - - An optional bucket containing the analytic thread - if there is no ambiguity in the analytic thread then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another analytic thread than the one currently being processed is undefined)

      • emergencyQuarantineBucket

        void emergencyQuarantineBucket(Optional<DataBucketBean> bucket,
                               String quarantine_duration)
        (AnalyticsTechnology/Analytics Module) Requests that the analytic thread be suspended for the specified duration - in addition to changing the analytic thread state, this will result in a call to IAnalyticsTechnologyModule.onSuspend
        Parameters:
        bucket - - An optional bucket containing the analytic thread - if there is no ambiguity in the analytic thread then Optional.empty() can be passed (Note that the behavior of the context if called on another analytic thread than the one currently being processed is undefined)
        quarantineDuration - A string representing the duration for which to quarantine the data (eg "1 hour", "2 days", "3600")

      • initializeNewContext

        void initializeNewContext(String signature)
        (Should never be called by clients) this is used by the infrastructure to set up external contexts
        Parameters:
        signature - the string returned from getAnalyticsContextSignature
